Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Controlled Reoxygenation Cardiopulmonary Bypass in Cyanotic Congenital Heart Defect Repair

Trial_Design.evidence: In a single-center, randomised controlled trial, 67 cyanotic patients

Participants.evidence: 67 cyanotic patients (median age 15 months, interquartile range 6–49 months) undergoing corrective cardiac surgery

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either controlled normoxic (50–0 mm Hg; n = 35) or hyperoxic (150–180 mm Hg; n = 32) cardiopulmonary bypass

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was myocardial damage, measured by troponin I levels, assessed preoperatively and at multiple time points postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors

Result_Outcome.evidence: Troponin I levels were significantly lower in the normoxic group (−29%, 95% CI −48% to −3%, P = .03)
